---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary

#### Import changes

No significant changes to the import graph

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ aeval_algHom`
`+ algEquiv`
`+ algEquivOfAssociated`
`+ algEquivOfAssociated_apply_root`
`+ algEquivOfAssociated_toAlgHom`
`+ algEquivOfEq`

`+ algEquivOfEq_toAlgHom`

`+ algHomOfDvd`

bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9448658257/job/26023143868)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9448658257/job/26023143580)

Thanks!

bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+
Maybe you only need `hp` and `h_eq`? Since `hq` can be derived by them. Same as the following results.
I am a bit hesitant about putting a "have" inside a definition, but I have changed it as suggested.
You can use `(h_eq ▸ hp)` at the places of `hq` (untested), in this way you don't need that `have`.
Thanks!
Can you split this construction assuming first of all that one polynomial divides the other (of course it won't be an iso)?

> Can you split this construction assuming first of all that one polynomial divides the other (of course it won't be an iso)?

And it can be called `algHomOfDvd` I think.
Anyway this file needs to be split... (in another PR)
Done!
Maybe it has to be split now, the linter is complaining...
You can always add a nolint and take care of this later. Or open a PR that does just the splitting.
OK, I have added a style exception for now.

Maybe you only need `IsAlgebraic K x` but not the whole `Algebra.IsAlgebraic K L`? Same as the following results.

Also, the `isAlgebraic_iff_isIntegral.mp (h_alg _)` can be rewritten as `(h_alg _).isIntegral` if you like (if you apply my previous suggestion, then it's `h_alg.isIntegral`), it's shorter.
Good point, thanks!

```suggestion
  rw [algEquiv, trans_apply, ← adjoinRootEquivAdjoin_apply_root K
```
(untested)

```suggestion
theorem aeval_algEquiv (f : B ≃ₐ[A] B) (x : B) : (Polynomial.aeval (f x)) (minpoly A x) = 0 := by
```

Maybe this should be called `algEquivOfEq`? And the two theorems `id_algEquiv_def'` and `id_algEquiv_def` should be called `coe_algEquivOfEq` and `algEquivOfEq_toAlgHom`?

More generally, `algEquivOfAssociated` should work, only requiring `p` and `q` are [Associated](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Associated.html#Associated).
Should it be `algEquivOfEq` or `algEquiv_of_eq`? The second option looks a bit better to me, but I see both patterns in Mathlib.

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/naming.html

> All other terms of Types (basically anything else) are in `lowerCamelCase`.

According to naming conventions, it should be called `algEquivOfEq`, since it's an `AlgEquiv` which is a `Type`.
Done!
There is no need to assume `f` to be an iso here.
Thanks! I have replaced this by `aeval_algHom`.

```suggestion
/-- If `x : L` is a root of `minpoly K y`, then we can find `(σ : L ≃ₐ[K] L)` with `σ x = y`.
```
`Normal` is a class, why not using `[Normal K L]`?

```suggestion
/-- If `x : L` is a root of `minpoly K y`, then we can find `(σ : L ≃ₐ[K] L)` with `σ y = x`.
```

```suggestion
  rfl

theorem algEquivOfAssociated_toAlgHom {p q : K[X]} (hp : p ≠ 0) (hpq : Associated p q) :
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(FieldTheory): add results about minpoly
